channel.title: My computer dosn;t recognize java =[ need help now!
channel.description:
ok...i cant run my gay server because this is what i get when i try to compile...
`javac` is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. press any key to continue . . .
and that was with pimpscape....

item.title: My computer dosn;t recognize java =[ need help now!
item.dc:creator: @F-0-N-Z-Y F-0-N-Z-Y
item.description:
@F-0-N-Z-Y wrote:

go to www.sun.java.com and download the JDK 6.0 update 2 or 3

then just follow mod taharok’s perfect compiler tutorial to run/compile your java.

Read full topic
item.source: My computer dosn;t recognize java =[ need help now!

item.title: My computer dosn;t recognize java =[ need help now!
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

You need the JDK not the JRE.

Read full topic
item.source: My computer dosn;t recognize java =[ need help now!

item.title: My computer dosn;t recognize java =[ need help now!
item.dc:creator: @zezima252 zezima252
item.description:
@zezima252 wrote:

[quote=“Tenacious T, post:4, topic:198966”]Do you have JDK and JRE downloaded?

If you are not sure go to.

Start-my computer-local disc-program files-Java (you should see two folders or more in there if not you dont have it if you do then you dont have the right version assigned to your runserver) to see if you have JAVAC.exe do those steps then enter the JDK folder, then go to bin, and see if you see JAVAC[/quote]

i have 4 folders…ill go in order of what they say…jre1.5.0_11, jre1.6.0_02, jre1.6.0_03, jre1.6.0_05
i checked inside jre1.6.0_05 and clicked bin and found this…javacpl…is that it??there is a couple more like that…javaw…javaws…are these ok??

Read full topic
item.source: My computer dosn;t recognize java =[ need help now!

item.title: My computer dosn;t recognize java =[ need help now!
item.dc:creator: @Tenacious_T Tenacious T
item.description:
@Tenacious_T wrote:

Do you have JDK and JRE downloaded?

If you are not sure go to.

Start-my computer-local disc-program files-Java (you should see two folders or more in there if not you dont have it if you do then you dont have the right version assigned to your runserver) to see if you have JAVAC.exe do those steps then enter the JDK folder, then go to bin, and see if you see JAVAC

Read full topic

item.description:
@Graham wrote:

You need to set your PATH environment variable: http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,200036.0.html#post_error
